meanings.definition: Having a harsh, low voice or sound
meanings.sent1: The frog's croakier call echoed through the swamp.
meanings.sent2: Her croakier voice made it difficult to understand her.
meanings.sent3: The croakier sound of the old radio made it seem like it was talking underwater.
meanings.sent4: The croakier tone of the rusty gate added to the eerie atmosphere of the abandoned house.
meanings.sent5: The croakier notes of the cello created a haunting melody.

meanings.sent1: The singer's voice was even croakier than before.
meanings.sent2: Today, the weather is croakier than yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The croakier cat meowed loudly for attention.
meanings.sent4: The croakier engine sputtered to life after a few tries.
meanings.sent5: The croakier frog in the pond was the loudest of them all.

meanings.definition: To make a deep, hoarse sound like a frog
meanings.sent1: The frog croakiered all night long, keeping us awake.
meanings.sent2: She croakiered in an attempt to imitate the frog's call.
meanings.sent3: The old man croakiered his displeasure at the noisy neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The wind croakiered through the branches of the trees.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house seemed to croakier with unseen voices in the darkness.
